author: Special Correspondent
text:
A large number of fishermen and their families observed a fast at Veerampatinam near here on Wednesday, urging the Centre and Union Territory Government to give up the proposed setting up of Coast Guard’s hoverport in their village.

Staying away from fishing, the villagers observed fast near Sengazhuneer amman temple and also shouted slogans against the Centre and UT Government.

Black flag on houses,

boats

They have also hoisted black flags on their houses and boats.

Though the fisherfolk have been opposing this project since its conceptualisation in 2004, the villagers have intensified their agitations against the project for recent days after Chief Minister laid stone for port on January 15.

Apprehending that their livelihoods would be affected by the setting up project, they alleged that their movement already has been restricted.
title: Veerampattinam fishermen observe fast
